programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Gabe Rygaard takes on the toughest challenge of his career; Papac Alaska goes to a remote, mountainous island to tackle the biggest job in the company's history; Greg Chapman starts on a quest to find a lost logging train.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Rygaard crew batles Mother Nature as temperatures climb; Joe is still reeling from his injury; Greg Chapman pulls an extremely rare double barrel log from the St John's River.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Gabe has to call upon his son Aidan to step up and fill the family shoes; an overcrowded landing means one wrong move could wipe out the Papac crew below; Greg's quest to find the Lost Log Train is back on track.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Washington, production's rising with the newest generation of Rygaard on the job; David Zitterkopf is back in action with his son Levi to take on their biggest; Papac's new unit puts the crew to the ultimate test.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Rygaard crew gets a surprise visit from logging legend Craig Rygaard; the Zitterkopfs face a major obstacle in their push to complete their largest ever job; Papac battles the Longest Yard unit with its mile long skyline.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Rygaard Logging is trying to get back on track with the help of patriarch Craig Rygaard; the Swampman's under the gun to build an emergency treetop storm shelter; David Zitterkopf's son Levi gets a crucial lesson in logging.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Gabe Rygaard pushes his crew to a breaking point; Gary and Eddie blow up their business to cash in on green gold; David Zitterkopf could see his family empire fall to pieces, with one wrong move; a mutiny is underway among the Chapman crew.

programme.desc: The Papac crew is moving on to the most remote and treacherous site of their season; the money is drying up for Greg Chapman and his crew is seeing red; Gary and Eddie's new venture is becoming a nightmare.

programme.desc: Mike Papac has to step in as Joe and Coatsey's arguments threaten to bring the job to a grinding halt; David Zitterkopf's back to work after an injury that threatened to end his season.

programme.desc: A storm's brewing over the Swamp Man and it's threatening to wash away his hopes of filling a huge order; Gabe deals with the aftermath of Aiden's mutiny; the Chapman crew's behind after they burned through their money chasing the Lost Logging Train.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Washington, three generations of Rygaard loggers are fighting for the crown; Papack Alaska Logging moves into their final section; Gary and Eddie see if their swamp logging gamble has paid off.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Papac Logging is barely holding onto their lead; the Rygaards will have to work as a team if they're gonna reclaim the title; Shelby Stanga's under the gun, but has a secret map to a possible stash of sunken logs.

programme.desc: Industry titans Pihl Logging and Rygaard Logging tackle some of their most challenging jobs yet; Frank Harkness makes a name for himself; Buckin' Billy Ray takes to the treetops of Vancouver Island, risking his life to keep other people safe.

programme.desc: An early addition of P.T. Barnum's autobiography; a 1966 Dodge Charger with a Hemi engine; a Napoleonic-era Imperial Guard sword.

programme.desc: A warm-up jersey signed by pro basketball player Kobe Bryant; an antique weapon; the book, "Leaving Las Vegas;" an early toaster.

programme.desc: A shower curtain signed by actor Anthony Perkins ("Psycho"); an 1882 Gold Certificate and a 1918 Federal Reserve note; an 1800s Millionaire Calculator; a 1950s Russian night-vision scope.

programme.desc: An autographed Led Zeppelin album; an antique whistle collection; a Doonesbury cartoon; a self-winding clock.

programme.title: Pawn Stars

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Everyone comes together to plan a surprise wedding for Phil and Kay, setting up a special ceremony on their land, which the whole family attends. Si distracts Phil and Kay by taking them on a "trip down memory lane" to different places.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After discovering that Martin has to miss a Friday night poker game for a planned date, the guys (as well as their wives) take turns figuring out the best way to coach him for romance.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys realize that Godwin has never really asked them for a favor, even though they are all always helping each other out.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Due to construction at Jase and Missy's house, Willie and Korie invite Jase and the kids to live with them while Missy is out of town visiting friends.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Because of a termite problem at Duck Commander, the guys are forced to find a different location to work from--Godwin's House.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: John Luke and Sadie are getting some dental work done, complete with sedation, and it's up to Willie and Korie to take care of them through the process.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Si shows up to work on a mobility scooter, claiming to have an invisible injury from a fender bender with Willie. After losing her beloved turtle "Mr. T", Ms.Kay enlists Phil on a mission to find a new pet turtle.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A decision to try and make some duck jerky leads the boys to Godwin's garage and a minibike race. Phil and Kay have made Willie the executor of their will, and Phil wants to show Willie what he and his brothers will inherit.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Si discovers Youtube, and, after watching a series of instructional videos, decides he can make something better.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertsons host a Halloween event at Duck Commander, where they all come together to transform the warehouse into a "scarehouse."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertsons perform a live nativity for their Church for Christmas, so the wives organize rehearsals to ensure that they pull off a great event.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie is looking to hire a new assistant, Korie insists he interview her cousin, JD. Willie is hesitant at first, but immediately hits it off with JD, who truly appreciates Willie's sense of humor.

programme.desc: After seeing footage Jep shot using a GoPro, Si decides he wants to use the camera to record a day in his life. But when Si gets on the guys nerves while they're hunting, they kick him and his GoPros out of the blind.

programme.desc: The team revamps an old school '34 Buick into a modern day lowrider; after months of rebuilding the body and making a custom frame for Earl Campbell's '49 Cadillac, the Hall of Famer challenges the shop with a last-minute wrinkle.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A long-time client wants to improve upon a near-perfect '68 Ford Ranger; the team is up to the task with an all-new custom chassis, handmade interior, rebuilt bed and Coyote 5.0 engine swap; the guys check off new custom upgrades on a '75 Bronco.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1996 Impala throws the guys for a loop when they discover it's an imposter; the team makes it better than ever, with custom body fabrications, rear subframe and handmade interior.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Truck builds tend to get bigger than originally planned, so it's no surprise when a 1971 Suburban goes even bigger with a custom lifted air suspension and interior; a nearly finished 2006 Kodiak needs just one more custom upgrade.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys get the F-Rod 1931 Model A fired up and ready for racing.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich beat on David's '99 Dodge Ram and Steve's '73 Chevy.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Sam Strube helps finish the '31 Model A "F-Rod" and take it to the track.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys vow to strip everything modern from the legendary '68 Charger.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys try to bring the "COVID-350" '56 Chevy Bel Air closer to perfect.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The '56 Chevy Field Car gets ready for its best time yet on the dragstrip.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Wiley Stevens helps get the '67 Bang Shifting Cougar back on the road.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich take the freshly painted Crop Duster to the track.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich begin piecing the '68 Dodge Charger back together.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The General Mayhem '68 Charger is back together and better than ever!

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger pits his '69 Ford Mustang Mach 1 Disgustang against Dulcich's '67 Mercury Bang-Shifting Cougar; after some suspension and rear-end modifications on the Cougar, the guys hit the road and an airport runway to see which is the better beater.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich give gold-medal examples of doing the wrong thing the right way with a big-block, four-speed '73 El Camino in need of an engine refresh; fixing a 454 that's obviously been messed with by means of a cheap at-home rebuild.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The problematic pig of a '73 El Camino named El Cochino is back; Freiburger and Dulcich address the camshaft and lifter issues that remain on their factory SS 454 four-speed Chevy, while also attempting to repair a terrible wheel-hop issue.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich rescue a flat-fender 1952 Jeep with a small-block Chevy.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Wiley Stevens helps Dulcich make the Bro-Charger into a roadworthy vehicle.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich take the racecar out of the Plymouth Crop Duster.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys replace their red 1971 Duster's seized slant-six with V-8 power.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich rescue Dirthead Dave's 1974 Chevy K20 long-bed.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich test three Roadkill creations at the dragstrip.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys road trip the '56 Bel Air Field Car to a drag strip in California.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich take their '71 Duster on Hot Rod's Power Tour.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The guys fix a fuel slosh and delivery issue in the Crusher Impala.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The '56 Chevy Field Car hopes to break into the 10s at the dragstrip.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill and the guys customize a brand new 2017 F350.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: After a 90's remodel, a purple '55 Chevy truck needs a modern update.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: A local restaurant owner asks Bill to customize his '61 Cadillac.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: The crew turns a bread truck into the ultimate T-shirt vending machine.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: A guy from TX wants to combine the shell of a '66 C10 with a '60s Impala.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: A long-time customer wants his F-250 4x4 lifted and made off-road ready.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Bill and the guys transform a wrecked 2017 F150 into a unique prerunner.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Hip-hop artist Slim Thug wants Ekstensive to dress up his old '59 Cadillac.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A client wants to set the bar for custom SUVs with a 2018 Yukon Denali.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill and the guys have built a lot of trucks, but never a Ford Bronco.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A Camaro ZL1 gets performance upgrades and a GMC Sierra drops to the floor.

programme.desc: The crew squeezes the '18 Camaro ZL for more power with an engine rebuild.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The '70 Suburban is finally revived, and a '65 Belvedere II gets a Hemi,

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A crumbling '52 Ford F4 milk truck becomes a dazzling diesel street rod.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A C10 gets new custom touches, and a Dodge Demon needs mods for the track.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A '70 Suburban is transformed, and an F-150 build will benefit charity.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 2018 Yukon Denali XL will be the shop's tallest build ever.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Converting a 1940 truck into a mobile barbecue pit tests the team's skills.

programme.desc: The team tries to outdo themselves with a redesign of 1950 Ford F5 COE.

programme.desc: The client asks for a last-minute engine swap on the '50 Ford F5 COE build.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Bill and the team fix another shop's botched lift on a 2017 Ford F-350.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: A '65 Ford Falcon Club Wagon is transformed into a custom family cruiser.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: A 1973 El Camino is transformed into the Ride of the Future.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: After a long pause, the team gets their chance to finish a 1968 Chevy C10.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1937 International Harvester gets a big old Cummins 12-valve diesel engine that's as heavy as the truck itself; a 2005 Chevy Colorado gets a new lease on life as a nitrous-infused drag truck.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1996 dump truck is the largest truck the shop has ever customized; the guys go extra heavy duty to create a military-styled megatruck; a lowrider enthusiast wants a custom air ride and LS swap for his pristine 1934 Buick.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: This year's over-the-top build has Bill and crew lifting a 2020 Chevy Silverado 5500 more than a foot with a custom heavy-duty air suspension; the guys also prove their Texas mettle by radically overhauling the utility bed.

programme.desc: HOF running back Earl Campbell arrives with the parts of a 1949 Cadillac,

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's the 18th day of the ice road season and truckers have delivered more than 3000 loads to the diamond mines. The temperatures are dropping, the loads are getting heavier.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's half way through the grueling ice road season. Six hundred truckers have ferried more than 4,000 loads to the northern mines.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Truckers have hauled more than 100,000 tons of supplies in temperatures of forty degrees below zero, but accidents and strict safety regulations have sent many drivers packing.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's just over a month into the new ice road season and more than 800 truckers are on the ice, working around the clock.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's day 37 of the ice road season and there almost 3,000 more loads to go. Drivers are washing out and the road is beaten up.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's day 53 of the ice road season and only the toughest truckers remain on a road that's sent many people packing.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Spring brings a rush of warm weather and the big melt begins. The road is nearly empty as only the toughest or craziest truckers remain.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It is a job only a few would dare. This year, four ice road truckers, Hugh, Alex, Rick and Drew, return from last season to join Arctic veterans.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: After just two days in the Arctic, the critical demands of the oil exploration sites are testing the limits of the truckers and their machines.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Just five days into the Arctic adventure, Mother Nature is about to strike and wreak havoc on the ice roads.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's week two on the frozen tundra and the name of the game is Rig Move. MGM is breaking down camp and moving every last piece of equipment to a new base at Langley.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: After the storm clears, most of the truckers are ready to roll--all except Rick, who is on the verge of quitting and looks to Hugh for advice.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The truckers have delivered the fragile 135-foot derrick to the new MGM exploration site.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Bear and Eric must haul a boiler and a flare stack--two critical pieces of equipment.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The bounty-hunter adventures of Duane "Dog" Chapman and his Posse are chronicled in this one hour "Best Of" special, featuring superlative memorable moments from the previous seven seasons.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog doesn't have the whole team today and he's got to catch a fugitive with a record of criminal assault. But when Dog finds the fugitive's former girlfriend, she thinks he isn't dangerous at all.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Back in Colorado, Dog`s on the hunt for a runner with more than a decade's worth of trouble with the law.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Fugitive beware: Dog's rolling with extra power today. His old friends Tim Chapman and Sonny Westbrook are riding with the team, so their target, a thief with violent tendencies, is out of luck.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Back in Colorado Dog tracks a fugitive who is on the run from the law for the first time. Reading the file Dog knows the young man's life is at the crossroads.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A small town bondsmen is in over his head, his business on the line, when he makes a desperate plea for help. Dog agrees and launches a high stake hunt through the desolate and dangerous mountain landscape of western Colorado.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Once in Montrose, Dog discovers that the million dollar fugitive is not the young bondsman's only problem. His kind heart and inexperience have led him to bail out a bevy of bail jumpers.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Can Dog complete his mission to clean-up this frontier town? With four outlaws still on the lam, Dog sets out to bring 'em in. As day turns into night and with the darkness and the danger mounting, an undaunted Dog and team plan late night hits.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: There's no rest for the righteous and nobody knows this better then the Dog. He is committed to saving his new friend's bail bonding business, and now must race against time to bring a rogues gallery to justice.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is sick as a dog, but he still must lead the hunt for a fugitive named James. James' girlfriend tries to cover for him, but Dog surprises James in his bedroom and leads him away in cuffs.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Beth buys Dog a shirt with an embroidered chicken that looks like a dragon, but Dog explains he only wears shirts with pictures of either Jesus or a Harley-Davidson. When it's time to go to work, the team goes after Necia.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's Christmas day, and Dog sets out to nab Raymond, who robs to support his ice habit, and give him a little Christmas gift - shiny new handcuffs. A passerby in Chinatown tells Dog that Raymond's asleep on a park bench.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Beth have their hands full when they go after their former housekeeper, Lisa, who's jumped bond. They know this case will be tricky because Lisa knows everyone in the family.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and his posse head to Colorado for a special mission--to catch Marco, an alleged drug dealer. It's been ten months since Marco went on the lam, and his bondsman stands to lose his family business if Marco is not caught.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This fugitive has a bad reputation and a knack for running from the law. The pursuit has Dog and team traveling through an urban dystopia of suspicion, false leads and mistrust.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A fugitive with a long criminal record has fled to Hawaii, and the bondsman on the mainland has asked Dog and the Posse for help. Dog doesn't have much information to work with, but he can use the felon's desire to impress his friends to track him down.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is back in Hawaii and tracking a dangerous fugitive through the jungles of the Big Island. Their prey is being protected by a ring of family and friends that Dog must forcefully confront to bring in his man.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and company head to the Big Island in pursuit of two courthouse no-shows only to find that one of them appears to be posting status updates from Southern California.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A big heart can be a problem for a bail bondsman and today's hunt is a case in point. Dog gave a break to a young man with a drug problem who promised to enter drug rehab.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is sick as a dog, but he still must lead the hunt for a fugitive named James. James' girlfriend tries to cover for him, but Dog surprises James in his bedroom and leads him away in cuffs.

programme.desc: The night begins with a birthday celebration for Susan Sutton; it ends with a nightmare when a man breaks in and opens fire, killing Susan and blinding her husband; when police track down the shooter, they can't believe who he said put him up to it.

programme.desc: After leaving a work party late at night, Ramona Krotinea's body gets discovered in the trunk of her own car the next day, and police need to reconstruct who and what happened in the intervening hours.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In Livermore, California, a love triangle sets two women on a collision course; a couple rekindles romance by visiting to a picturesque region of Michigan, but only one of them is coming home.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In Maryland, a real body turns up after a murder mystery dinner; in Adelaide, South Australia, a love rival winds up dead.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In New Port Richey, Florida, a sex party has a gruesome ending; on the outskirts of London, England, farmyard animals could hold the key to what's happened to a missing wife.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Beginning in summer of 1990, the bodies of several women began turning up in and around the city of Vienna, Austria. From an extensive investigation by the Viennese police, it was determined that these murders were the work of one sadistic predator. Europe was dealing with a serial killer. With no experience with this kind of predator, Viennese police turned to the FBI. FBI profilers were able to identify a suspect in the murders. More ominously, they linked this same killer to murders committed in the United States.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A 1981 armored car robbery near New York City left one guard dead and another critically wounded. Police stopped suspects nearby and another shoot-out ensued, claiming the lives of two officers. Local police and the FBI suspected a large group of domestic terrorists with a history of violent crime. They would try to ferret out these heavily armed criminals who moved in a shadowy underworld and were not afraid to kill authorities.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1986, a small crime free Indiana town was turned inside out by the arrival of one dangerous stranger. After an officer was gunned down at point-blank range, the psychotic killer led investigators across the Midwest. No one knew where the gunman would strike next, even as his tally of murders and abductions grew. The FBI and state police raced against time to rescue America's heartland from this deranged gunman, before he killed again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When violent criminals strike, the FBI strikes back, employing every available resource, and creating new ones when necessary. From forensic science to criminal profiling, specialized intelligence to global fugitive tracking, the agents of the FBI battle the bad guys with a most powerful arsenal: the crime-fighter's toolbox. This special episode of The FBI Files celebrates the groundbreaking science, investigative technique, and gut-level instinct that has made the FBI the world's premier law enforcement agency.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a California man was found dismembered in 1990, police suspected a local burglar, but they couldn't find him. Six months later, he was caught robbing an Arizona bank and sentenced to life. But prison couldn't hold him for long, and within a year he escaped. The FBI would lead a multi-agency manhunt for a killer on a desperate run through the tourist regions of the west.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In October 1993, a robber surprised unsuspecting customers by dropping through the roof of a California bank. When police arrived, he escaped from the roof in a hail of bullets. A tip from a local resident led police and FBI agents to the perpetrator. They would soon learn that he had masterminded a local kidnapping, and held the fate of an innocent woman in his hands.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: By April of 1995 in Washington, D.C., two officers had been shot and one had been murdered. Each had been sitting in their patrol cars when a man sneaked up and opened fire. The FBI was brought in to help catch the cop killer. Agents identified the man who was most likely the killer, but he was nowhere to be found. Months of surveillance operations around the country finally yielded a break; they found their suspect in Baltimore, MD.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: This is the story of the FBI's first capture of an international Lebanese terrorist. In June 1985, the terrorist and his four accomplices hijacked Royal Jordanian flight #405 shortly before take off in Beirut, Lebanon. On board were American citizens, a professor and his teen son. The FBI opened a criminal investigation and worked with various other government agencies to form Operation Goldenrod, a task force specifically charged with bringing the terrorist to justice in 1989.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On Mississippi's Gulf Coast, a judge and his politician wife were brutally murdered in their home. The killer left few clues and the investigation led nowhere. But the FBI was patiently waiting in the wings. Once it was determined that federal laws had been violated, they pounced on the investigation. They uncovered a corrupt local government and a group of violent criminal conspirators known as the Dixie Mafia, responsible for fraud, money laundering and murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Alabama, a pair of convicted felons escaped the custody of a local deputy and fled across the country. Eluding authorities, they moved from state to state in a wave of abduction and car theft. When a foreign military officer disappeared along their trail, police and FBI agents wondered if the armed fugitives had become killers. Agents believed the pair were growing more violent and raced to find the escapees before more victims crossed their path.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 1970s, the FBI had a working knowledge of anti-Castro terrorists operating in the United States. But then a new group appeared, more violent and aggressive than their predecessors. All agents had to go on was a series of chilling phone calls, a mysterious voice, and the threat of more violence. FBI field offices from New York to Miami coordinated their efforts, determined to catch the vicious killers.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A man is found suffocated in his Pennsylvania home, his checkbook, credit cards and vehicle appear to have been stolen. Fingerprints from the victim identify a recent escapee from a minimum-security prison, as well as his girlfriend. Investigators flag the dead man's credit cards, and are alerted when one is used in North Dakota. The FBI is called in and joins another task force already assembled because of a suspected kidnapping.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the mid-1990's, a gang of professional bank robbers raided cities across seven states. Disguises and speed protected their identity from cameras and the police as they stole hundreds of thousands of dollars, always leaving a bomb to terrorize their victims. The stakes were raised when the FBI discovered the robbers had an agenda beyond their personal wealth. To stop these extremists and their growing operation, the FBI needed to capture their leaders.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Larry Horn nearly got away with the perfect crime: a multiple murder-for-hire plot that was meticulously planned and executed. Horn's former wife, their 8-year-old son, and a live-in nurse were all brutally murdered by an assassin. In the absence of any significant clues, police in Maryland contacted the FBI to assist in the investigation.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: It's a late night and a Vietnam veteran with a history of mental illness is drunk and stumbling through an apartment complex. When the police arrive, he pulls a gun and shoots himself in the head.

programme.desc: Dr. G. has just graduated from medical school and is set to begin her first job as an M.E. in Jacksonville, Florida when a high-profile case challenges her to use her newly acquired skills.

programme.desc: When Dr. G receives Lea Conrad's body, she suspects the woman may have died from an antihistamine overdose. Then, Dr. G learns that Lea was being treated for lupus.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Melissa Riobe's life is ruled by her addiction to drugs. Now, the 42-year-old woman has learned how to buy powerful prescription drugs online without a doctor's note.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Both natural disease and sport's injury are likely suspects in Eric Brody's death. But then Dr. G learns that he was treated with antibiotics for a spider bite prior to his death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An elderly woman is driving when she's overcome with shooting pains and crashes her car. She's rushed to the hospital, but the doctors find nothing wrong. Can Dr. G find the cause of death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G preforms an autopsy on an alleged hit-and-run victim but finds no evidence of vehicular injury on the 41-year-old man's body. Could his alcoholism have had a role in his death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A healthy 53-year-old woman is found dead in bed. After performing an autopsy and taking blood and tissue samples, Dr. G cannot find the cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: It is 3am and Deputy Torres is cruising a Texas highway when he suddenly spots a crushed pick-up truck along the side of the road. Trapped inside is the lifeless body of 24-year-old Luis Reyes.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G reviews a woman's medical records and learns that that she suffered from an auto-immune disease called lupus, which might have something to do with her death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.desc: Police are driving down the street when a man suddenly jumps in front of their car. They screech to a halt and avoid hitting him, but the man is highly agitated.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A train passenger behaves oddly en route to Arizona and then disappears. The next day his bloodied body is found in Texas. Dr. G attempts to piece together this bizarre tragedy.

programme.desc: During her career as a medical examiner, Dr. G has autopsied thousands of murder victims. In this episode, Dr. G shares her most memorable case.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Accounts of creatures that can shape shift from one form into another can be found, but could similarities between the ancient stories and modern-day alien abduction accounts reveal that shape shifters are real and have come to Earth.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A look at if ancient aliens could have shaped human evolution by introducing viral epidemics on Earth.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Throughout the ancient world, tales are told of fire-breathing dragons; though fearsome, they have been worshipped as the bringers of great knowledge and credited as the founders of civilization.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Archaeologists discover that many ancient sites were constructed with an acoustic purpose and often resonate at a frequency that has a profound effect on the human brain; questioning whether ancient people used these sites to contact alien beings.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos takes a look back at some of the structures visited all over the world that could provide undeniable evidence of extraterrestrial contact.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Many mysteries of planet Earth are far from understood. How was Devil's Tower formed? Or why do some people get struck by lightning multiple times?

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: From the ancient Babylonians to modern-day urban explorers, mankind has always been fascinated by abandoned places; discovering the allure that draws people to post-apocalyptic landscapes.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Ancient practices such as prayer, blood sports, voodoo, and exorcism are often thought to be relics of bygone superstition.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Perhaps the greatest unexplained mystery of all is: what happens to us after we die? Perhaps clues to the answer lie in unusual cases of near-death experience.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: From ancient civilizations to 20th century empires, mankind has had an inexplicable fascination with preserving the dead. But why?

programme.desc: What gives animals extraordinary powers? We like to think of ourselves as the peak of evolution--but what if we're wrong?

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: What motivates someone to steal? Is it just for the money, or could a criminal have other reasons for pulling off a particularly daring robbery?

programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: On February 2, 2010, two gunmen shoot a man, rendering him a quadriplegic for five years before his death. DNA from a knife is used to create a sketch of the killer.

programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: When a schoolteacher is found murdered in the fall of 2009, suspicion is cast on her soon to be ex-husband. Now, a detective embarks on a mission to help the man clear his name.

programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: Firefighter Gary Parks is killed in a fire ruled arson, the investigation into his death shifts to homicide. A serial arsonist is thought to be the culprit.

programme.title: Cold Case Files: The Rifkin Murders
programme.desc: A TV producer leverages his relationship with Joel Rifkin, New York's most prolific serial killer, to get information police could use to discover the identities of the two remaining unknown victims.

programme.title: Cold Case Files: The Rifkin Murders
programme.desc: After 30 years, serial killer Joel Rifkin provides clues to New York State Police to identify two of his 17 victims, the only who remain nameless.

programme.desc: The suspicious death of 2-year-old Billy Blankenship is solved.

programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: Chuck and Cheryl Hall are torn apart when Chuck finds Cheryl murdered. Cheryl's family is certain they know her killer. After several decades, a DNA match erases all doubt.

programme.desc: On a bitter morning in 1980, Helene Pruszynski is found brutalized in a field.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 1980's, a pair of serial bank robbers gained a reputation among law enforcement officials as formidable bandits. Using the same modus operandi, the two men took hostages and emptied bank vaults across the Midwest. After the criminals escaped from police custody, FBI agents familiar with the bandits believed that they would attempt a grand-scale heist. By conducting surveillance on known associates of the criminals, authorities tried to anticipate the next target.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On a summer afternoon in upscale Lodi, California, a 12-year-old girl is abducted from her home. Scores of police officers and FBI agents converge, determined to find the young girl before it is too late. When the kidnapper's car is discovered in a field near Lodi, police dogs, helicopters, and hundreds of volunteers are employed in a round-the-clock search. It would take a community united in concern for one of their youngest to find the missing child.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the 1980s, the drug trade ravages Chicago's inner city neighborhoods and violent crime threatens to destroy entire communities. As drug profits grow, gangs rule the streets. One of the most dangerous is the El Rukns. FBI Agents team up with state and local police to bring them down, but in the process, uncover a bizarre and frightening terrorist plot.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1999, Police investigate two brutal murders in two small towns located hundreds of miles apart. The crimes seem random and unrelated, until investigators discover a terrifying link. Local police and the FBI must untangle a web of liesto stop a dangerous gang that will kill a man for his Identity.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A New Jersey State Trooper is shot to death on the side of Interstate 80 near the Pennsylvania border. Witnesses to the shooting identify the shooter's car. Police issue an APB, and locate the vehicle hours later. Fingerprinting of the vehicle points to a fugitive wanted on bank robbery charges. Authorities who inspect the fugitive's home find some incriminating evidence including a box of bullets linked to the Trooper's murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On the day before Thanksgiving, a mother discovered her 10 year-old son was missing from his school. No one knew how it could have happened. Within hours, the boy's entire family was frantically searching for him. The few leads in the case quickly turned cold and the FBI was called in to aid in the investigation. The search by agents and local authorities would cover a thousand miles to expose the kidnapper and find the missing child.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Arizona, a shipment of money vanished into the high desert, along with the two men hired to guard it. The FBI didn't know if the guards were participants or victims of an ambush. Answers lay somewhere in the thousands of square miles of Arizona's northwest territory. When the vehicle was recovered with three hundred thousand dollars and the drivers missing, suspicions that the crime was an inside job grew.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1996, a group of political extremists twice robbed a bank in Spokane, Washington, using homemade bombs and military precision to escape. The FBI learned that the robbers, part of a shadowy organization called the Phineas Priesthood, might be preparing for a small-scale war with law enforcement. After the suspects were identified, the FBI was faced with the task of safely arresting a group of terrorists with a deadly agenda.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the mid-1990's, a gang of professional bank robbers raided cities across seven states. Disguises and speed protected their identity from cameras and the police as they stole hundreds of thousands of dollars, always leaving a bomb to terrorize their victims. The stakes were raised when the FBI discovered the robbers had an agenda beyond their personal wealth. To stop these extremists and their growing operation, the FBI needed to capture their leaders.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the winter of 2001, two well-loved and respected college professors are found murdered in their home. Nothing about the case makes sense. No items are missing from the home and the couple had no known enemies. Local police and FBI agents form a task force to find a pair of homegrown killers and a motive for the brutal crime they committed.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Philadelphia, a ruthless grab for power leads to a full-scale mob war. The local Mafia crime family splits in two as the young and the old fight to the death. The FBI is caught in the middle as they infiltrate the syndicate through informants and high-tech surveillance. Agents must find a way to bring down the organization before their civil war leads to innocent causalities.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In February 1988, a record store clerk in Sandusky, Ohio, was fatally shot in his van. After discovering a night deposit bag with thousands of dollars in the vehicle, police knew that robbery was not the motive, and began to investigate other possibilities. FBI agents learned that several motorcycle gang members had been stopped nearby on a traffic violation shortly after the murder and theorized that the clerk's murder may have been a botched hit carried out by a gang member.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In July 1996, two men entered a pawnshop in Birmingham, Alabama, and ruthlessly murdered the employees. Unbeknownst to the killers, a secret video surveillance camera recorded the shooting. Local police and the FBI released images of the crime to the media, and were quickly able to identify the perpetrators. Now authorities had to find two cold-blooded killers who knew that they were being pursued for murder one.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In August 1992, a man returned to his Memphis home and discovered that his wife was missing. The husband, as well as his friends, family and neighbors began to receive ransom calls. FBI agents noticed that one neighbor seemed to have the best rapport with the kidnapper. They began to question his level of involvement, but had to proceed carefully, knowing that he could be their only link to the missing woman.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: At 9:30 am on the morning of January 30, 1997, Richmond, VA police respond to a report of shots fired at a local bank. Two masked men brandishing automatic weapons confront, and open fire on officers responding to the call. The gunmen exit the bank, and retreat on foot, eventually eluding the officers. The FBI soon responds, only to find one bank teller dead, another wounded, and the bank's security guard shot four times, yet still alive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 80's, Florida's cocaine imports were among the highest in the nation. Regional territories were enforced with intimidation and murder. Desperate to stop the violence, local authorities turned to the FBI for help. One dealer bowed to no one. He would stop at nothing to keep detectives and agents from building a case against him. When his organization began targeting the government itself, a city went on high alert.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1990 and 1991, Chicago police and the FBI were on the trail of a bank robber whose holdups were becoming increasingly violent. The criminal consistently used stolen Japanese cars to carry out the robberies, so authorities hoped to identify him by tracking vehicle thefts. When they finally located the man known as the bearded bandit, they learned that he did not work alone and he had made a pact never to surrender.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1991, the Safe Streets Task Force, a joint FBI / Washington D.C. Metropolitan Police Department organization, begins conducting an investigation into the violent activities of a local gang called the K Street Crew. Gang members are suspected of involvement in several area homicides. The FBI approaches several witnesses, hoping to convince them to testify against the gang members. Seven potential witnesses are murdered during the course of the investigation.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 90s, a gang based in the U.S. Virgin Islands began smuggling thousands of kilos of cocaine into mainland America. Police and federal agents target the gang, but its leader remains a mystery. In an investigation spanning from Georgia to South America, local police, the DEA, U.S. Customs and the FBI work together to take down this dangerous drug gang.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the Spring of 1997, a killer preying on senior citizens terrorizes the River Parish area of Southern Louisiana. By May, local police and the New Orleans FBI are exploring a connection between the April 9 murder of a 71-year old widow and the May 9 murder of a retired couple. A month later, authorities forward information on the crimes to the FBI's Behavioral Science Unit in Quantico, VA, hoping a profile will help them narrow the field of possible suspects.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the 1980's the New York City Police Department is fighting a losing battle in the war on drugs. Distributors and drug gangs in New York are making millions, and they will do anything to protect their profits. After two law enforcement officers are targeted, hundreds of police officers and FBI agents devise a bold plan to crackdown on the drug gangs and shut down their deadly business.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 1980s, the FBI matches wits with a cunning bank robber -- a lone gunman responsible for the longest string of unsolved bank robberies in FBI history. The robber's planning is meticulous. He executes his crimes with military precision. It will take the combined skills of local police and dozens of agents to catch a criminal mastermind they call, "The Shootist."

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1992, a young mother was gunned down in front of her children. Police searched for answers, but found none. The horrible crime appeared unmotivated, senseless, and random. Then, family members offered a startling clue. The victim, the wife of a prominent Atlanta attorney, was also a woman burdened with a secret; a secret the FBI believed led to her death. It would force local and federal agents to untangle an intricate web of money, drugs and murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In September 1997, a team of masked gunmen robbed an armored car facility in Los Angeles, and made off with $18.9 million, the largest takeover heist in U.S. history. An employee believed she recognized the voice of one of the robbers, and FBI agents began conducting surveillance on a former employee of the facility. With only one piece of physical evidence, a fragment of a vehicle taillight, authorities hoped to connect him to the crime, and locate his accomplices.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. But a tragic twist of fate intervened, when she found herself an innocent victim of the drug trade. Kidnapped and held captive, she survived for days against all odds. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In October 1993, a robber surprised unsuspecting customers by dropping through the roof of a California bank. When police arrived, he escaped from the roof in a hail of bullets. A tip from a local resident led police and FBI agents to the perpetrator. They would soon learn that he had masterminded a local kidnapping, and held the fate of an innocent woman in his hands.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the 1970's, Otpor, a violent arm of the Croatian National Resistance commits terroristic acts against non-supportive Croatians living in the U.S. With the help of an informant, the FBI is able to apprehend, arrest and convict members of the group for crimes ranging from conspiracy and extortion to murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: At 9:30 am on the morning of January 30, 1997, Richmond, VA police respond to a report of shots fired at a local bank. Two masked men brandishing automatic weapons confront, and open fire on officers responding to the call. The gunmen exit the bank, and retreat on foot, eventually eluding the officers. The FBI soon responds, only to find one bank teller dead, another wounded, and the bank's security guard shot four times, yet still alive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A Labor Day weekend turned into a nightmare of murder as a cross-country crime spree terrorized the nation. In a small Ohio community, an elderly woman and a teenage boy disappeared within hours of each other. Police believed the cases were linked, but didn't know how. They contacted the FBI for help. A trail of stolen vehicles and murder victims across seven states led agents on a hunt for two suspected killers. Their only hope of stopping them was to anticipate the killers' next move.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Philadelphia, a ruthless grab for power leads to a full-scale mob war. The local Mafia crime family splits in two as the young and the old fight to the death. The FBI is caught in the middle as they infiltrate the syndicate through informants and high-tech surveillance. Agents must find a way to bring down the organization before their civil war leads to innocent causalities.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A Washington DC professor is shot and killed as she tries to get into her car. The killer leaves the body in the parking lot and drives away in her vehicle. A week later, a man robs a bank, and security cameras capture the same vehicle as the getaway car. The FBI believes they are dealing with the same man. Days later, the same vehicle is involved in a shootout with police, but eventually would elude them. Eventually, the vehicle is found, the interior covered with red dye from the stolen bank packs.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Amid the cocaine wars of early 1980's Miami, three dead bodies led a multi-agency tactical squad to suspect that a group of cops might be involved in illegal drug busts. Investigating rumors of corruption, the squad uncovered a ring of patrolmen who were making millions by ripping off smuggled cocaine. The investigators set out to prove that even with the advantages wealth and the protection of a police badge, nobody is above the law.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1996, a group of political extremists twice robbed a bank in Spokane, Washington, using homemade bombs and military precision to escape. The FBI learned that the robbers, part of a shadowy organization called the Phineas Priesthood, might be preparing for a small-scale war with law enforcement. After the suspects were identified, the FBI was faced with the task of safely arresting a group of terrorists with a deadly agenda.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1988, new light was shed on the mysterious death of a South Carolina farmer when a criminal confessed that two prominent community members hired him to commit murder. Local police and FBI agents arrested a wealthy businessman and later learned that, even behind bars, he commanded the power to corrupt and kill. Using prison informants, agents had to prevent him from murdering again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June 1973, a young girl was abducted from a state park on the Missouri River while camping with her family. Several months passed with no leads, then an FBI agent took a particular interest in the case. Using a new technique known as criminal profiling, he predicted that the kidnapper would contact the girl's family on the one-year anniversary of her abduction. When this prediction came true, the FBI agent noted behavioral clues, hoping that they could lead him to the kidnapper.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A day that began with a class field trip ended with a parent's worst nightmare. An 11-year-old girl was missing. Her parents were certain she was no runaway. When they failed to find her in their quiet Illinois neighborhood, they called the police. The FBI soon joined the investigation and family and friends worked with detectives and agents in an urgent search for the missing girl. Faced with conflicting witness reports and false leads, agents wouldn't stop until they found the girl, and the truth.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Puerto Rico, violent militants are intent on turning the US Commonwealth into a communist dictatorship. They murder a policeman, turns their guns on a busload of unarmed Navy workers, and even launch an attack on the FBI. These ruthless killers have vowed to fight to the death. The FBI must use every tactic at their disposal to track down the terrorists and bring them to justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: An Arkansas State Trooper is shot and killed after pulling over a van for a traffic violation. Officers apprehend the shooter, after a car chase and shootout. ATF is alerted when officers find weapons and explosives in the man's vehicle. Further testing of the weapons reveals one was used in a murder several months earlier. ATF traces some of the firearms to purchases made by another man from and arms dealer. They also match silencer marks from the weapons to a third man previously arrested for stealing a flatbed truck.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In rural Texas, 13-year-old is kidnapped on her way to school. Frantic to find her safely, her millionaire father calls local authorities and the FBI. As police officers and agents conduct aerial surveillance, the father drives hundreds of miles through the night to deliver the ransom cash to a drop that the kidnappers keep changing. In a final effort to save the young girl, investigators must engage in a dangerous firefight with five desperate criminals.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Lincoln County, Nebraska, a fugitive drug dealer engaged in a shootout with state troopers, wounding two of them, and eluded capture after a high-speed chase. Authorities immediately set up a statewide manhunt, connecting the fugitive to a murder in western Nebraska. A chance sighting led FBI agents to a second confrontation with the killer, who was more determined than ever to escape the law.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1986, a small crime free Indiana town was turned inside out by the arrival of one dangerous stranger. After an officer was gunned down at point-blank range, the psychotic killer led investigators across the Midwest. No one knew where the gunman would strike next, even as his tally of murders and abductions grew. The FBI and state police raced against time to rescue America's heartland from this deranged gunman, before he killed again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Washington D.C, a car bomb takes the life of a former ambassador and his secretary. The FBI is on the case and begins sifting through layers of a wide-ranging conspiracy. The scope of the investigation broadens when it becomes apparent that a foreign government, ruled by a ruthless dictator, ordered the attack. Agents and prosecutors must engage in a political tug-of-war to uncover the identities of the assassins.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: This is the story of the FBI's first capture of an international Lebanese terrorist. In June 1985, the terrorist and his four accomplices hijacked Royal Jordanian flight #405 shortly before take off in Beirut, Lebanon. On board were American citizens, a professor and his teen son. The FBI opened a criminal investigation and worked with various other government agencies to form Operation Goldenrod, a task force specifically charged with bringing the terrorist to justice in 1989.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 80's, Florida's cocaine imports were among the highest in the nation. Regional territories were enforced with intimidation and murder. Desperate to stop the violence, local authorities turned to the FBI for help. One dealer bowed to no one. He would stop at nothing to keep detectives and agents from building a case against him. When his organization began targeting the government itself, a city went on high alert.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In August 1984, the son of a successful real estate developer was kidnapped in front of his father's business in Miami. After the father received a $3 million ransom demand from a self-proclaimed terrorist, the FBI became involved. Based on witness descriptions of the car used in the kidnapping, authorities began to suspect a pair of Colombian nationals with a known grudge against the developer's family.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Kokomo, Indiana an unthinkable crime terrified residents. A young woman was snatched from her home on a bright spring morning. Drops of blood and a torn window screen were all that was left to tell authorities what happened to the twenty-one year old victim. After several days of searching, a former FBI profiler narrowed the suspect list to one. Agents and detectives followed the trail across state lines hoping to find the victim before her time ran out.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Steven Dean Gordon and Frank Cano murder at least four sex workers in California between 2012 and 2013.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Malcolm Green is jailed for life for the brutal murder of a Cardiff prostitute; he kills again when he is released after 18 years.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: The story of Mark Martin, who murdered three homeless women in his quest to become Nottingham's first serial killer.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: The story of two friends who carried out the evil, jealousy-fuelled murder of Sadie Hartley.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Sarah Williams and Katrina Walsh, the two friends carry out the jealousy-fuelled murder of Sadie Hartley.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Jordan Monaghan kills his 24-day-old daughter Ruby on New Year's Day in January 2013.

programme.title: Death Walker With Nick Groff
programme.desc: Nick will be the first person to conduct a paranormal investigation inside the Electro Magnetic Sanatorium.

programme.title: Death Walker With Nick Groff
programme.desc: Nick sets out to investigate the Haunted Hill House in Mineral Wells, Texas.

programme.title: Death Walker With Nick Groff
programme.desc: Nick meets occult expert Bloody Mary.

programme.title: Death Walker With Nick Groff
programme.desc: Nick visits the Octagon Hall, a property built by a secret society known as the Freemasons.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: In 2022, investigative genetic genealogy exposes a killer who stabbed a woman to death in her home in 1980.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: A woman who was sexually assaulted at gunpoint in the 1980s contacts a genetic genealogist to solve her case.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: In 1986, police struggle to find a young mother's killer; years later, can genetic genealogy provide answers?

programme.title: Making a Serial Killer
programme.desc: The so-called Leaf Killer led police on a manhunt after brutally killing an entire family.

programme.title: Making a Serial Killer
programme.desc: The suburbs of Seminole Heights, Florida was rocked by a series of murders by a disgruntled college graduate.

programme.title: Making a Serial Killer
programme.desc: Derrick Todd Lee, known as the Baton Rouge Serial Killer, terrorized Louisiana from 1992 to 2003.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder
programme.desc: Assia Newton had left her abusive marriage and dreamt of a new life with her Tunisian lover.¬† But her estranged husband had other plans.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder
programme.desc: Wanting rid of the husband she hated, Faria Khan launched a murderous plot involving a group of wannabe rappers.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder
programme.desc: In 1999 pregnant mum of three Debbie Griggs disappeared without a trace. Twenty years later police finally solved the mystery.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder
programme.desc: Sana Muhammad escaped an arranged marriage and found true happiness with a new man. Until her ex-husband began hunting her down.

programme.title: Murdered at First Sight
programme.desc: 14-year-old Jermaine Cools is the victim of a brutal machete stabbing after walking past a fight in Croydon.

programme.title: Murdered at First Sight
programme.desc: Michael Hoolickin meets up with friends to enjoy a pint but has no idea it will be his last.

programme.title: Murdered at First Sight
programme.desc: 11-year-old Jeralee leaves home on her local newspaper route. It's dusk when her parents become worried.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: The chilling story of Lee Ford, who killed his wife and four stepchildren in a murder spree.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: A double murderer is found guilty of the brutal assassination of an elderly couple.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: The story of serial killer Geoffrey Evans and his accomplice John Shaw, who hit headlines in 1976.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: A 23-year-old killer murders 17-year-old former head girl Georgia Williams in 2013.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: William Bonin is known to some as the 'Freeway Killer,' thought to have raped, tortured and murdered a minimum of twenty-one boys and young men before he was executed in 1996.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: A woman murders her sister after developing a deadly obsession with her brother-in-law.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Thirty-two years later, a convicted killer serving life for manslaughter is found to be guilty of having committed a second murder.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: A killer who found some of his victims through ads, the case of Paul Runge became prominent in the debate over the death penalty in Illinois.

programme.title: Killers: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A young woman disappears after meeting up with an old flame. In the UK, a dating app-related murder unfolds.

programme.title: Killers: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A spree killer is on the loose in New Mexico. In Colorado, a mother is found dead inside an isolated cabin.

programme.title: Killers: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A young woman is stalked, but her cry for help is ignored. An estranged husband threatens to kill his wife.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder
programme.desc: After Sophie Cavanagh left husband Martin, he did everything he could to continue spending time with her - and to stop her meeting another man.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder
programme.desc: Greg and Michele Williams were attacked in their home. He died, she survived. How would detectives unpick what really happened?

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder
programme.desc: Dallas Augustine had wealth, a wife she loved, and a fledgling political career. But drinking and violence caused it all to fall apart.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder
programme.desc: A politician meets her future husband in the hospital as she mourns her previous husband‚Äôs life. What she doesn‚Äôt know is he wants to get her out of the picture.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder
programme.desc: Melanie and David Clark‚Äôs marriage was volatile, passionate, sometimes abusive. It ended when one of them snapped and picked up a knife.

programme.title: Women Behind Bars
programme.desc: One woman is convicted of murdering her boyfriend, while another woman shot her husband during an argument.

programme.title: Women Behind Bars
programme.desc: Jocelyn was found guilty of murder in the 2003 fatal stabbing of her lover, 23-year-old Melanie Ramirez. Gwen pled not guilty to murder in the 1991 death of her husband. She claimed she was hearing voices that told her to sacrifice her husband to God, the jury convicted her and she was sentenced to life in prison.

programme.title: Women Behind Bars
programme.desc: Roberta and Donna along with Roberta's on-again/off-again boyfriend were convicted for the 1996 attempted murder of Donna's husband. In 1999, Evelyn with two friends kidnapped, tortured and murdered a woman. She was sentenced to 45 years in prison.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: Detectives and forensic experts recount the most extraordinary cold cases that were solved using the revolutionary technique of familial DNA testing.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: In 1964, the body of a young girl is discovered in Hazleton, Pa.; the community lives in fear that a child predator is hiding in plain sight; over 50 years later, the truth is finally revealed.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: In 1990, a Mississippi woman is kidnapped and raped at knifepoint; the case goes cold for decades until a DNA match from an unrelated crime identifies the perpetrator.

programme.title: Killers: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A mother is found shot in her car with no witnesses. A son kills his veteran father, claiming self-defense.

programme.title: Killers: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A dead woman in a car is linked to two brothers. Trash bags full of body parts are found in a shed.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: A man from Iowa is shot to death while sleeping in bed next to his fiancee; coincidences and quick thinking lead to surprising information regarding the killer's motive.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: The sister of a man who died after robbing a bank when a bomb that was placed around his neck detonated talks about the case.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: The father of an Alabama teenager calls the police after he returns home to find his son had thrown a party, leaving the place trashed; 11 minutes after the deputy leaves the house, another 911 call is placed reporting a shooting at the residence.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: An investigation of abuse allegations against one of the owners of religious reform school Circle of Hope.
